Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor code cleanup/beautification in RelationPutHeapTuple.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Initial implementation of concurrent VACUUM. Ifdef'd out for the moment, because index locking issues are not handled correctly yet. Need to go work on the index AMs next.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch fixes problems with the JDBC driver handling long null terminated strings. The FE/BE protocol sends in some cases null terminated strings to the client. The docs for the FE/BE protocol state that there is no limit on the size of a null terminated string sent to the client and a client should be coded using an expanding buffer to deal with large strings. The old code did not do this and gave an error if a null terminated string was greater than either 4 or 8K. It appears that with the advent of TOAST very long SQL statements are becoming more common, and apparently some error messages from the backend include the SQL statement thus easily exceeding the 8K limit in the old code. In fixing I also cleaned up some calls in the JDBC fastpath code that were not doing character set conversion under multibyte, and removed some methods that were no longer needed. I also removed a potential threading problem with a shared variable that was being used in Connection.java. Thanks to Steve Wampler for discovering the problem and sending the initial diffs that were the basis of this patch. thanks, --Barry

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: TODO item: * Make n of CHAR(n)/VARCHAR(n) the number of letters, not bytes

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make sure the build tree is before the source tree in the include path.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change xgettext rule to run in the source tree, so we don't have the absolute paths of the source tree in the po files. Also, run msgfmt with -c option in maintainer-check.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: NLS for libpq. Clean up the message formats and change the documentation accordingly.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add ORDER BY to a couple of test queries whose output ordering is not as predictable as it used to be, due to recycling of free space with new VACUUM.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure index AM interface for index building and index tuple deletion, per previous discussion on pghackers. Most of the duplicate code in different AMs' ambuild routines has been moved out to a common routine in index.cSEMICOLON this means that all index types now do the right things about inserting recently-dead tuples, etc. (I also removed support for EXTEND INDEX in the ambuild routines, since that's about to go away anyway, and it cluttered the code a lot.) The retail indextuple deletion routines have been replaced by a "bulk delete" routine in which the indexscan is inside the access method. I haven't pushed this change as far as it should go yet, but it should allow considerable simplification of the internal bookkeeping for deletions. Also, add flag columns to pg_am to eliminate various hardcoded tests on AM OIDs, and remove unused pg_am columns. Fix rtree and gist index types to not attempt to store NULLsSEMICOLON before this, gist usually crashed, while rtree managed not to crash but computed wacko bounding boxes for NULL entries (which might have had something to do with the performance problems we've heard about occasionally). Add AtEOXact routines to hash, rtree, and gist, all of which have static state that needs to be reset after an error. We discovered this need long ago for btree, but missed the other guys. Oh, one more thing: concurrent VACUUM is now the default.

Document.document: Partial indexes work again, courtesy of Martijn van Oosterhout. Note: I didn't force an initdb, figuring that one today was enough. However, there is a new function in pg_proc.h, and pg_dump won't be able to dump partial indexes until you add that function.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Do not push down quals into subqueries that have LIMIT/OFFSET clauses, since the added qual could change the set of rows that get past the LIMIT. Per discussion on pgsql-sql 7/15/01.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve documentation about reasoning behind the order of operations in GetSnapshotData, GetNewTransactionId, CommitTransaction, AbortTransaction, etc. Correct race condition in transaction status testing in HeapTupleSatisfiesVacuum --- this wasn't important for old VACUUM with exclusive lock on its table, but it sure is important now. All per pghackers discussion 7/11/01 and 7/12/01.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid assuming that pg_index table entries have unique OIDs, or even that they have OIDs at all (the primary key for this table is indexrelid, not OID). Simplify overly complex query to get name of primary key.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Disallow non-cachable functions in functional indexes and in index predicates. Per suggestion from Hiroshi.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: New-style vacuum neglected to update pg_class statistics about indexes if there were no deletions to do.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Arrange to recycle old XLOG log segment files as new segment files, rather than deleting them only to have to create more. Steady state is 2*CHECKPOINT_SEGMENTS + WAL_FILES + 1 segment files, which will simply be renamed rather than constantly deleted and recreated. To make this safe, added current XLOG file/offset number to page header of XLOG pages, so that an un-overwritten page from an old incarnation of a logfile can be reliably told from a valid page. This change means that if you try to restart postmaster in a CVS-tip database after installing the change, you'll get a complaint about bad XLOG page magic number. If you don't want to initdb, run contrib/pg_resetxlog (and be sure you shut down the old postmaster cleanly).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: i've spotted a following problem using DBD::Pg under win32. winsock functions do not set errno, so some normal conditions are treated as fatal errors. e.g. fetching large tuples fails, as at some point recv() returns EWOULDBLOCK. here's a patch, which replaces errno with WSAGetLastError(). i've tried to to affect non-win32 code. Dmitry Yurtaev

Document.document: Load pg_hba.conf and pg_ident.conf on startup and SIGHUP into List of Lists, and use that for user validation. Bruce Momjian

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch merges the identical methods from the JDBC1 and JDBC2 connection implementations (org.postgresql.jdbc[1|2].Connection) into their superclass (org.postgresql.Connection). It also changes the close() methods of Connection and PG_Stream, so that PG_Stream no longer is responsible for sending the termination packet 'X' to the backend. I figured that protocol-level stuff like that belonged in Connection more than in PG_Stream. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: momjian

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Change SQL commands embedded in the initdb script from the style echo "command"| postgres to the style postgres <<EOF command EOF This makes the script more legible (IMHO anyway) by reducing the need to escape quotes, and allows us to execute successive SQL commands in a single standalone-backend run, rather than needing to start a new standalone backend for each command. With all the CREATE VIEWs that are getting done now, this makes for a rather substantial reduction in the runtime of initdb. (Some of us do initdb often enough to care how long it runs SEMICOLON-).)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix unportable coding for FRONTEND case.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove WIN32_NON_BLOCKING_CONNECTIONS tests, since we don't need 'em anymore.

Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update info on pg_hba.conf comments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update 'translate' function description. translate does character set mapping, not character strings.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix optimizer to not try to push WHERE clauses down into a sub-SELECT that has a DISTINCT ON clause, per bug report from Anthony Wood. While at it, improve the DISTINCT-ON-clause recognizer routine to not be fooled by out- of-order DISTINCT lists.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix optimizer to not try to push WHERE clauses down into a sub-SELECT that has a DISTINCT ON clause, per bug report from Anthony Wood. While at it, improve the DISTINCT-ON-clause recognizer routine to not be fooled by out- of-order DISTINCT lists. Also, back-patch earlier fix to not push down into sub-SELECT with LIMIT.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Further thought shows that has_distinct_on_clause() needs to take much more care with resjunk tlist entries than it was doing. The original coding ignored resjunk entries entirely, but a resjunk entry that is in either the distinctClause or sortClause lists indicates that DISTINCT ON was used. It's important for ruleutils.c to get this right, else we may dump views using DISTINCT ON incorrectly.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cleanup code for preparsing pg_hba.conf and pg_ident.conf. Store line number in the data structure so that we can give at least a minimally useful idea of where the mistake is when we issue syntax error messages. Move the ClientAuthentication() call to where it should have been in the first place, so that postmaster memory releasing can happen in a reasonable place also. Update obsolete comments, correct one real bug (auth_argument was not picked up correctly).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add documentation changes for new pg_hba.conf behavior.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add mention of SIGHUP for pg_ident.conf.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: When invoked with -i (initialize mode), split the copy command every 10000 tuples, rather than one big copy. This will prevent generating too much WAL logs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Message typo was fixed in sources, but not in de.po.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The fti.pl supplied with the fulltextindex module generate ALL possible substrings of two characters or greater, and is case-sensitive. This patch makes it work correctly. It generates only the suffixes of each word, plus lowercases them - as specified by the README file. This brings it into line with the fti.c function, makes it case-insensitive properly, removes the problem with duplicate rows being returned from an fti search and greatly reduces the size of the generated index table. It was written by my co-worker, Brett Toolin. Christopher Kings-Lynne

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached ia a patch to enable window size detection code of psql for Solaris platform. TIOCGWINSZ is defined as follows: Linux asm/ioctls.h FreeBSD sys/ttycom.h. This file is included by sys/ioctl.h. Solaris sys/termios.h This patch tells print.c to know TIOCGWINSZ on Solaris platform. Same code is founded in src/bin/psal/common.c. Kenji Sugita

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a trivial patch to add ANALYZE to the tab complete file in psql. Randy Hall

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Support ident authentication on local (Unix) socket connections, if the system supports SO_PEERCRED requests for Unix sockets. This is an amalgamation of patches submitted by Helge Bahmann and Oliver Elphick, with some editorializing by yours truly.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Digging through previous discussion of this patch, I note where Peter E. points out how silly it is to use Autoconf to test for a preprocessor symbol, when one can equally easily #ifdef on the symbol itself. Accordingly, revert configure to prior state and do it that way.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove SO_PASSCRED step in ident_unix --- according to Helge Bahmann, that call is not needed to prepare for SO_PEERCRED. Also, simplify code so that #ifdef SO_PEERCRED appears in only one place, to make it easier to support other platforms with variants of this capability.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Even though SO_PEERCRED is probably totally unportable, might as well declare the getsockopt parameter as ACCEPT_TYPE_ARG3 to be consistent with our other uses of getsockopt.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I noticed that pltcl didn't have any way to get to SPI_lastoid like plpgsql does.. I started using pltcl a lot because I like to decide when and how my queries get planned.. so I put one together really quick Sorry I don't have the original around to make a quick diff, but its a very small change... I think this should be in the next release, there's no reason not to have it. its a function with no expected arguments, so you can use it like: spi_exec "INSERT INTO mytable(columns...) VALUES(values..)" set oid [spi_lastoid] spi_exec "SELECT mytable_id from mytable WHERE oid=$oid" It just didn't make sense for me to use plpgsql and pltcl, or just screw them both and use SPI from C. bob@redivi.com

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some poor decisions about sizing of trigger-related memory contexts.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak memory context sizing for saved SPI plans.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a SPI_copytupledesc function that parallels SPI_copytuple --- ie, it copies the tupdesc into upper-executor memory. This is necessary for returning tuple descriptors without leaking all of lower exec memory.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up various memory leaks within plpgsql, and re-enable the exec_eval_simple_expr shortcut, which was diked out in 7.1 because it leaked too much space. CVS tip now leaks no memory in Chris Ruprecht's example, which formerly leaked to the tune of 500 MB. (Much of this is work that Jan already didSEMICOLON this commit just cleans up around the edges.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix pg_dump so that comments on views are dumped in the proper sequence. Dump the alignment and storage information for user-defined types (how'd that manage to slip through the cracks?), and don't dump 'shell' types that don't have typisdefined set. Fix badly broken logic for dependencies of type definitions (did not work for more than one user-defined type...). Avoid memory leakage within pg_dump by being more careful to release storage used by PQExpBuffer objects.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fixes for dumping user-defined types and dumping comments on views.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: For some reason, CREATE TYPE has only accepted alignment specifications of 'int4' and 'double'. Add 'char' and 'int2' to allow user-defined types to access the full set of supported alignments.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix win32.mak to support MULTIBYTE build --- it was pulling in several backend files that it shouldn't anymore, causing compile failures. Per report from Darko Prenosil.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix residual breakage from Windows socket-errno patch: the routines that should use regular errno, not WSAGetLastError(), now do so again.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix handling of SIGCHLD, per recent pghackers discussion: on some platforms system(2) gets confused unless the signal handler is set to SIG_DFL, not SIG_IGN. pgstats.c now uses pqsignal() as it should, not signal(). Also, arrange for the stats collector process to show a reasonable ID in 'ps', rather than looking like a postmaster.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch that does the following: 1) improves performance of commit/rollback by reducing number of round trips to the server 2) uses 7.1 functionality for setting the transaction isolation level 3) backs out a patch from 11 days ago because that code failed to compile under jdk1.1 Details: 1) The old code was doing the following for each commit: commit begin set transaction isolation level xxx thus a call to commit was performing three round trips to the database. The new code does this in one round trip as: commitSEMICOLON beginSEMICOLON set transaction isolation level xxx In a simple test program that performs 1000 transactions (where each transaction does one simple select inside that transaction) has the following before and after timings: Client and Server on same machine old new --- --- 1.877sec 1.405sec 25.1% improvement Client and Server on different machines old new --- --- 4.184sec 2.927sec 34.3% improvement (all timings are an average of four different runs) 2) The driver was using 'set transaction isolation level xxx' at the begining of each transaction, instead of using the new 7.1 syntax of 'set session characteristics as transaction isolation level xxx' which only needs to be done once instead of for each transaction. This is done conditionally (i.e. if server is 7.0 or older do the old behaviour, else do the new behaviour) to not break backward compatibility. This also required the movement of some code to check/test database version numbers from the DatabaseMetaData object to the Connection object. 3) Finally while testing, I discovered that the code that was checked in 11 days ago actually didn't compile. The code in the patch for Connection.setCatalog() used Properties.setProperty() which only exists in JDK1.2 or higher. Thus compiling the JDBC1 driver failed as this method doesn't exist. Thus I backed out that patch. Barry Lind

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > 1) When a row is retrieved, and then a SQL_FETCH_FIRST is issued, the check > in convert.c > does not consider the fact that the value in the field has been altered to > be a '1' if the > backend handed it a 't'. The net result being that the first row on any > subsequent queries > has all it's boolean set to 0. Aidan Mountford

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: 1. Fixed error with empty array ( '{}' ), test data changed to include such data 2. Test a dimension of an array ( we support only one-dimension) Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Looks okay in a quick glance, except error message spelling is poor: ! #define ARRISNULL(x) ( (x) ? ( ( ARR_NDIM(x) == NDIM ) ? ( ( ARRNELEMS( x ) ) ? 0 : 1 ) : ( ( ARR_NDIM(x) ) ? (elog(ERROR,"Array is not one-dimentional: %d di mentions", ARR_NDIM(x)),1) : 1 ) ) : 1 ) Should be "one-dimensional" and "dimensions". Bruce, would you fix that when you apply it? Tom

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add LOCK A,B,C functionality as LOCK ASEMICOLONLOCK BSEMICOLONLOCK CSEMICOLON as agreed. Neil Padgett

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch adds the following to the FTI module: * The ability to index more than one column in a table with a single trigger. * All uses of sprintf changed to snprintf to prevent users from crashing Postgres. * Error messages made more consistent * Some changes made to bring it into line with coding requirements for triggers specified in the docs. (ie. check you're a trigger before casting your context) * The perl script that generate indices has been updated to support indexing multiple columns in a table. * Fairly well tested in our development environment indexing a food database's brand and description fields. The size of the fti index is around 300,000 rows. * All docs and examples upgraded. This includes specifying more efficient index usage that was specified before, better examples that don't produce duplicates, etc. Christopher Kings-Lynne & Brett

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch is because Hurd does not support NOFILE. It is against current cvs. The Debian bug report says, "The upstream source makes use of NOFILE unconditionalized. As the Hurd doesn't have an arbitrary limit on the number of open files, this is not defined. But _SC_OPEN_MAX works fine and returns 1024 (applications can increase this as they want), so I suggest the below diff. Please forward this upstream, too." Oliver Elphick

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Compile fix for jdbc1.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out LOCK A,B,C patch at Tom's suggestion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove no-longer-needed fcntl call (I'm not sure it *ever* did anything useful, in fact).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Endeavor to make pgstats buffer process (a) safe and (b) useful. Make sure it exits immediately when collector process dies --- in old code, buffer process would hang around and compete with the new buffer process for packets. Make sure it doesn't block on writing the pipe when the collector falls more than a pipeload behind. Avoid leaking pgstats FDs into every backend.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Show index predicate when doing BACKSLASHd on a partial index.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Surely the pg_stat interrogation functions must not be marked proiscachable.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add QueryIsRule gram.y reset.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Check that the data directory does not have group or world accessSEMICOLON remove a similar check on postgresql.conf.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: update from upstream

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Do not pre-expand localedir as substituted in the makefile, so that 'make install prefix=elsewhere' works.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Evaluate LIMIT/OFFSET expressions with ExecEvalExprSwitchContext, not ExecEvalExpr, to avoid possible memory leak.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Modify partial-index-predicate applicability tester to test whether clauses are equal(), before trying to match them up using btree opclass inference rules. This allows it to recognize many simple cases involving non-btree operations, for example 'x IS NULL'. Clean up code a little.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Seems like a bad idea to free() a string we are about to use in an error message.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Use a fixed error message for ERANGE to avoid duplicate test result files. Add some resultmap entries for SCO OpenServer.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Doesn't seem to be much point in keeping this README up to date anymore, since it's completely redundant with regress.sgml. I think we agreed to remove it awhile back, actually, but no one got around to doing it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix thinko (revealed by gcc warning).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Per this discussion, here's a patch to implement both levenshtein() and metaphone() in a contrib. There seem to be a fair number of different approaches to both of these algorithms. I used the simplest case for levenshtein which has a cost of 1 for any character insertion, deletion, or substitution. For metaphone, I adapted the same code from CPAN that the PHP folks did. A couple of questions: 1. Does it make sense to fold the soundex contrib together with this one? 2. I was debating trying to add multibyte support to levenshtein (it would make no sense at all for metaphone), but a quick search through the contrib directory found no hits on the word MULTIBYTE. Should worry about adding multibyte support to levenshtein()? Joe Conway

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: A small patch to keep postgres working on the latest BeOS. Cyril VELTER

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I think you replaced too many things with put(... Document.author: momjian
Document.document: 1. null-safe interface to GiST (as proposed in http://fts.postgresql.org/db/mw/msg.html?mid=1028327) 2. support for 'pass-by-value' arguments - to test this we used special opclass for int4 with values in range [0-2^15] More testing will be done after resolving problem with index_formtuple and implementation of B-tree using GiST 3. small patch to contrib modules (seg,cube,rtree_gist,intarray) - mark functions as 'isstrict' where needed. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to remove some redundant code in the JDBC driver. * Merges identical code from org.postgresql.jdbc[1|2].Statement into org.postgresql.Statement. * Moves escapeSQL() method from Connection to Statement (the only place it's used) * Minor cleanup of the new isolation level stuff. * Minor cleanup of version string handling. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The portion about the PQgetssl() function in the libpq documentation appears to be duplicated (two identical <listitems> right after each other). Here is a quick patch to remove one instance of it. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: No longer need TODO.detail/lock.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: message refinements

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix collateral damage from error message cleanup.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make OIDs optional, per discussions in pghackers. WITH OIDS is still the default, but OIDS are removed from many system catalogs that don't need them. Some interesting side effects: TOAST pointers are 20 bytes not 32 nowSEMICOLON pg_description has a three-column key instead of one. Bugs fixed in passing: BINARY cursors work againSEMICOLON pg_class.relhaspkey has some usefulnessSEMICOLON pg_dump dumps comments on indexes, rules, and triggers in a valid order. initdb forced.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cleanup some minor oversights in optional-OIDs stuff.

Document.document: CREATE VIEW with optional column name list wasn't quite right for the case where there are resjunk columns in the query.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Support ident authentication on local (Unix) socket connections, if the system supports SO_PEERCRED requests for Unix sockets. This is an amalgamation of patches submitted by Helge Bahmann and Oliver Elphick, with some editorializing by yours truly.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cleanup code for preparsing pg_hba.conf and pg_ident.conf. Store line number in the data structure so that we can give at least a minimally useful idea of where the mistake is when we issue syntax error messages. Move the ClientAuthentication() call to where it should have been in the first place, so that postmaster memory releasing can happen in a reasonable place also. Update obsolete comments, correct one real bug (auth_argument was not picked up correctly).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I think you replaced too many things with put(... Here is a context diff from latest cvs And I see why you couldn't apply the last diff, the setCatalog diff has been backed out, that was causing the compile problem in the first place. This following one needs to be applied to allow the current cvs to compile Dave Cramer

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Russian translation by Serguei Mokhov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix residual breakage from Windows socket-errno patch: the routines that should use regular errno, not WSAGetLastError(), now do so again.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: i've spotted a following problem using DBD::Pg under win32. winsock functions do not set errno, so some normal conditions are treated as fatal errors. e.g. fetching large tuples fails, as at some point recv() returns EWOULDBLOCK. here's a patch, which replaces errno with WSAGetLastError(). i've tried to to affect non-win32 code. Dmitry Yurtaev

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor performance improvement in MultiRecordFreeSpace.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor code cleanup/beautification in RelationPutHeapTuple.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: message refinements

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Looks okay in a quick glance, except error message spelling is poor: ! #define ARRISNULL(x) ( (x) ? ( ( ARR_NDIM(x) == NDIM ) ? ( ( ARRNELEMS( x ) ) ? 0 : 1 ) : ( ( ARR_NDIM(x) ) ? (elog(ERROR,"Array is not one-dimentional: %d di mentions", ARR_NDIM(x)),1) : 1 ) ) : 1 ) Should be "one-dimensional" and "dimensions". Bruce, would you fix that when you apply it? Tom

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Message typo was fixed in sources, but not in de.po.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix unportable coding for FRONTEND case.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Open Unix 8 patch (Caldera Unixware). Still needs updated autoconf. Larry Rosenman

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: JDBC encoding additions. Here's a patch against the current CVS. The changes from the previous patch are mostly related to the changed interface for PG_Stream. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Initial implementation of concurrent VACUUM. Ifdef'd out for the moment, because index locking issues are not handled correctly yet. Need to go work on the index AMs next.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert removal of relhaspkey supportSEMICOLON fix unnecessary use of pg_index.oid.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Use format_type sibling in backend error messages, so the user sees consistent type naming.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Check that the data directory does not have group or world accessSEMICOLON remove a similar check on postgresql.conf.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: For some reason, CREATE TYPE has only accepted alignment specifications of 'int4' and 'double'. Add 'char' and 'int2' to allow user-defined types to access the full set of supported alignments.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fixes for dumping user-defined types and dumping comments on views.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a trivial patch to add ANALYZE to the tab complete file in psql. Randy Hall

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch fixes problems with the JDBC driver handling long null terminated strings. The FE/BE protocol sends in some cases null terminated strings to the client. The docs for the FE/BE protocol state that there is no limit on the size of a null terminated string sent to the client and a client should be coded using an expanding buffer to deal with large strings. The old code did not do this and gave an error if a null terminated string was greater than either 4 or 8K. It appears that with the advent of TOAST very long SQL statements are becoming more common, and apparently some error messages from the backend include the SQL statement thus easily exceeding the 8K limit in the old code. In fixing I also cleaned up some calls in the JDBC fastpath code that were not doing character set conversion under multibyte, and removed some methods that were no longer needed. I also removed a potential threading problem with a shared variable that was being used in Connection.java. Thanks to Steve Wampler for discovering the problem and sending the initial diffs that were the basis of this patch. thanks, --Barry

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add TOAST table to the set of relkinds known to BACKSLASHd.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: update from upstream

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch is because Hurd does not support NOFILE. It is against current cvs. The Debian bug report says, "The upstream source makes use of NOFILE unconditionalized. As the Hurd doesn't have an arbitrary limit on the number of open files, this is not defined. But _SC_OPEN_MAX works fine and returns 1024 (applications can increase this as they want), so I suggest the below diff. Please forward this upstream, too." Oliver Elphick

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix handling of SIGCHLD, per recent pghackers discussion: on some platforms system(2) gets confused unless the signal handler is set to SIG_DFL, not SIG_IGN. pgstats.c now uses pqsignal() as it should, not signal(). Also, arrange for the stats collector process to show a reasonable ID in 'ps', rather than looking like a postmaster.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Do not push down quals into subqueries that have LIMIT/OFFSET clauses, since the added qual could change the set of rows that get past the LIMIT. Per discussion on pgsql-sql 7/15/01.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: NLS for libpq. Clean up the message formats and change the documentation accordingly.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make sure the build tree is before the source tree in the include path.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix collateral damage from error message cleanup.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Czech translation for psql from Karel Zak

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Modify partial-index-predicate applicability tester to test whether clauses are equal(), before trying to match them up using btree opclass inference rules. This allows it to recognize many simple cases involving non-btree operations, for example 'x IS NULL'. Clean up code a little.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More EXTEND INDEX removal. Martijn van Oosterhout

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change xgettext rule to run in the source tree, so we don't have the absolute paths of the source tree in the po files. Also, run msgfmt with -c option in maintainer-check.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: No longer need TODO.detail/lock.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to remove some redundant code in the JDBC driver. * Merges identical code from org.postgresql.jdbc[1|2].Statement into org.postgresql.Statement. * Moves escapeSQL() method from Connection to Statement (the only place it's used) * Minor cleanup of the new isolation level stuff. * Minor cleanup of version string handling. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Add new files for the preparation.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out LOCK A,B,C patch at Tom's suggestion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: 1. Fixed error with empty array ( '{}' ), test data changed to include such data 2. Test a dimension of an array ( we support only one-dimension) Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add mention of SIGHUP for pg_ident.conf.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move EncodingTest.java file.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add ORDER BY to a couple of test queries whose output ordering is not as predictable as it used to be, due to recycling of free space with new VACUUM.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: 1. null-safe interface to GiST (as proposed in http://fts.postgresql.org/db/mw/msg.html?mid=1028327) 2. support for 'pass-by-value' arguments - to test this we used special opclass for int4 with values in range [0-2^15] More testing will be done after resolving problem with index_formtuple and implementation of B-tree using GiST 3. small patch to contrib modules (seg,cube,rtree_gist,intarray) - mark functions as 'isstrict' where needed. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix thinko (revealed by gcc warning).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Endeavor to make pgstats buffer process (a) safe and (b) useful. Make sure it exits immediately when collector process dies --- in old code, buffer process would hang around and compete with the new buffer process for packets. Make sure it doesn't block on writing the pipe when the collector falls more than a pipeload behind. Avoid leaking pgstats FDs into every backend.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure index AM interface for index building and index tuple deletion, per previous discussion on pghackers. Most of the duplicate code in different AMs' ambuild routines has been moved out to a common routine in index.cSEMICOLON this means that all index types now do the right things about inserting recently-dead tuples, etc. (I also removed support for EXTEND INDEX in the ambuild routines, since that's about to go away anyway, and it cluttered the code a lot.) The retail indextuple deletion routines have been replaced by a "bulk delete" routine in which the indexscan is inside the access method. I haven't pushed this change as far as it should go yet, but it should allow considerable simplification of the internal bookkeeping for deletions. Also, add flag columns to pg_am to eliminate various hardcoded tests on AM OIDs, and remove unused pg_am columns. Fix rtree and gist index types to not attempt to store NULLsSEMICOLON before this, gist usually crashed, while rtree managed not to crash but computed wacko bounding boxes for NULL entries (which might have had something to do with the performance problems we've heard about occasionally). Add AtEOXact routines to hash, rtree, and gist, all of which have static state that needs to be reset after an error. We discovered this need long ago for btree, but missed the other guys. Oh, one more thing: concurrent VACUUM is now the default.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: update

Document.author: petere
Document.document: update

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Doesn't seem to be much point in keeping this README up to date anymore, since it's completely redundant with regress.sgml. I think we agreed to remove it awhile back, actually, but no one got around to doing it.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: update from upstream

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Compile fix for jdbc1.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch adds the following to the FTI module: * The ability to index more than one column in a table with a single trigger. * All uses of sprintf changed to snprintf to prevent users from crashing Postgres. * Error messages made more consistent * Some changes made to bring it into line with coding requirements for triggers specified in the docs. (ie. check you're a trigger before casting your context) * The perl script that generate indices has been updated to support indexing multiple columns in a table. * Fairly well tested in our development environment indexing a food database's brand and description fields. The size of the fti index is around 300,000 rows. * All docs and examples upgraded. This includes specifying more efficient index usage that was specified before, better examples that don't produce duplicates, etc. Christopher Kings-Lynne & Brett

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Patch to add comments to Linux startup script. Rene Pijlman

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid assuming that pg_index table entries have unique OIDs, or even that they have OIDs at all (the primary key for this table is indexrelid, not OID). Simplify overly complex query to get name of primary key.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Partial indexes work again, courtesy of Martijn van Oosterhout. Note: I didn't force an initdb, figuring that one today was enough. However, there is a new function in pg_proc.h, and pg_dump won't be able to dump partial indexes until you add that function.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Surely the pg_stat interrogation functions must not be marked proiscachable.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak memory context sizing for saved SPI plans.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached ia a patch to enable window size detection code of psql for Solaris platform. TIOCGWINSZ is defined as follows: Linux asm/ioctls.h FreeBSD sys/ttycom.h. This file is included by sys/ioctl.h. Solaris sys/termios.h This patch tells print.c to know TIOCGWINSZ on Solaris platform. Same code is founded in src/bin/psal/common.c. Kenji Sugita

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Disallow non-cachable functions in functional indexes and in index predicates. Per suggestion from Hiroshi.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove some unused node symbols

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Seems like a bad idea to free() a string we are about to use in an error message.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Even though SO_PEERCRED is probably totally unportable, might as well declare the getsockopt parameter as ACCEPT_TYPE_ARG3 to be consistent with our other uses of getsockopt.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Digging through previous discussion of this patch, I note where Peter E. points out how silly it is to use Autoconf to test for a preprocessor symbol, when one can equally easily #ifdef on the symbol itself. Accordingly, revert configure to prior state and do it that way.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove libpq TODO.detail. We don't need it any more because the item is done.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix fault in message.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix Cygwin build, per Jason Tishler.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix Cygwin build, per Jason Tishler.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Evaluate LIMIT/OFFSET expressions with ExecEvalExprSwitchContext, not ExecEvalExpr, to avoid possible memory leak.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Great, here is a context diff of CVS for implementing the get/setCatalog methods in Connection - note: I've updated setCatalog(String catalog) from my previous diff so it checks whether it is already connected to the specified catalog. Jason Davies

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve documentation about reasoning behind the order of operations in GetSnapshotData, GetNewTransactionId, CommitTransaction, AbortTransaction, etc. Correct race condition in transaction status testing in HeapTupleSatisfiesVacuum --- this wasn't important for old VACUUM with exclusive lock on its table, but it sure is important now. All per pghackers discussion 7/11/01 and 7/12/01.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Show index predicate when doing BACKSLASHd on a partial index.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix pg_dump so that comments on views are dumped in the proper sequence. Dump the alignment and storage information for user-defined types (how'd that manage to slip through the cracks?), and don't dump 'shell' types that don't have typisdefined set. Fix badly broken logic for dependencies of type definitions (did not work for more than one user-defined type...). Avoid memory leakage within pg_dump by being more careful to release storage used by PQExpBuffer objects.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: XML conversion utility, requires expat library. John Gray

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: New-style vacuum neglected to update pg_class statistics about indexes if there were no deletions to do.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Document column-name-list option of CREATE VIEW ... which has been there awhile, but the man page didn't know it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Commit BEOS patch to 7.1.X.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Do not pre-expand localedir as substituted in the makefile, so that 'make install prefix=elsewhere' works.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The fti.pl supplied with the fulltextindex module generate ALL possible substrings of two characters or greater, and is case-sensitive. This patch makes it work correctly. It generates only the suffixes of each word, plus lowercases them - as specified by the README file. This brings it into line with the fti.c function, makes it case-insensitive properly, removes the problem with duplicate rows being returned from an fti search and greatly reduces the size of the generated index table. It was written by my co-worker, Brett Toolin. Christopher Kings-Lynne

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: When invoked with -i (initialize mode), split the copy command every 10000 tuples, rather than one big copy. This will prevent generating too much WAL logs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Arrange to recycle old XLOG log segment files as new segment files, rather than deleting them only to have to create more. Steady state is 2*CHECKPOINT_SEGMENTS + WAL_FILES + 1 segment files, which will simply be renamed rather than constantly deleted and recreated. To make this safe, added current XLOG file/offset number to page header of XLOG pages, so that an un-overwritten page from an old incarnation of a logfile can be reliably told from a valid page. This change means that if you try to restart postmaster in a CVS-tip database after installing the change, you'll get a complaint about bad XLOG page magic number. If you don't want to initdb, run contrib/pg_resetxlog (and be sure you shut down the old postmaster cleanly).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Sorry - I should have gotten to this sooner. Here's a patch which you should be able to apply against what you just committed. It rolls soundex into fuzzystrmatch. Remove soundex/metaphone and merge into fuzzystrmatch. Joe Conway

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix win32.mak to support MULTIBYTE build --- it was pulling in several backend files that it shouldn't anymore, causing compile failures. Per report from Darko Prenosil.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up various memory leaks within plpgsql, and re-enable the exec_eval_simple_expr shortcut, which was diked out in 7.1 because it leaked too much space. CVS tip now leaks no memory in Chris Ruprecht's example, which formerly leaked to the tune of 500 MB. (Much of this is work that Jan already didSEMICOLON this commit just cleans up around the edges.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove SO_PASSCRED step in ident_unix --- according to Helge Bahmann, that call is not needed to prepare for SO_PEERCRED. Also, simplify code so that #ifdef SO_PEERCRED appears in only one place, to make it easier to support other platforms with variants of this capability.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update info on pg_hba.conf comments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Source formatting cleanup.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update branding for 7.1.3, no HISTORY yet.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: A small patch to keep postgres working on the latest BeOS. Cyril VELTER

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch that does the following: 1) improves performance of commit/rollback by reducing number of round trips to the server 2) uses 7.1 functionality for setting the transaction isolation level 3) backs out a patch from 11 days ago because that code failed to compile under jdk1.1 Details: 1) The old code was doing the following for each commit: commit begin set transaction isolation level xxx thus a call to commit was performing three round trips to the database. The new code does this in one round trip as: commitSEMICOLON beginSEMICOLON set transaction isolation level xxx In a simple test program that performs 1000 transactions (where each transaction does one simple select inside that transaction) has the following before and after timings: Client and Server on same machine old new --- --- 1.877sec 1.405sec 25.1% improvement Client and Server on different machines old new --- --- 4.184sec 2.927sec 34.3% improvement (all timings are an average of four different runs) 2) The driver was using 'set transaction isolation level xxx' at the begining of each transaction, instead of using the new 7.1 syntax of 'set session characteristics as transaction isolation level xxx' which only needs to be done once instead of for each transaction. This is done conditionally (i.e. if server is 7.0 or older do the old behaviour, else do the new behaviour) to not break backward compatibility. This also required the movement of some code to check/test database version numbers from the DatabaseMetaData object to the Connection object. 3) Finally while testing, I discovered that the code that was checked in 11 days ago actually didn't compile. The code in the patch for Connection.setCatalog() used Properties.setProperty() which only exists in JDK1.2 or higher. Thus compiling the JDBC1 driver failed as this method doesn't exist. Thus I backed out that patch. Barry Lind

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update 'translate' function description. translate does character set mapping, not character strings.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I downloaded new source for lib (only few hours old !!!), and made changes on this new source to make non-blocking connection work. I tested it, and PQSendQuery and PQGetResult are working fine. In win32.h I added one line: #define snprintf _snprintf Darko Prenosil

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Patch to LOCK multiple tables in one LOCK command. Neil Padgett

Document.author: petere
Document.document: No longer a need for -Wno-error

Document.author: petere
Document.document: some clarifications inspired by the DocNotes

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix optimizer to not try to push WHERE clauses down into a sub-SELECT that has a DISTINCT ON clause, per bug report from Anthony Wood. While at it, improve the DISTINCT-ON-clause recognizer routine to not be fooled by out- of-order DISTINCT lists. Also, back-patch earlier fix to not push down into sub-SELECT with LIMIT.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix optimizer to not try to push WHERE clauses down into a sub-SELECT that has a DISTINCT ON clause, per bug report from Anthony Wood. While at it, improve the DISTINCT-ON-clause recognizer routine to not be fooled by out- of-order DISTINCT lists.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Change SQL commands embedded in the initdb script from the style echo "command"| postgres to the style postgres <<EOF command EOF This makes the script more legible (IMHO anyway) by reducing the need to escape quotes, and allows us to execute successive SQL commands in a single standalone-backend run, rather than needing to start a new standalone backend for each command. With all the CREATE VIEWs that are getting done now, this makes for a rather substantial reduction in the runtime of initdb. (Some of us do initdb often enough to care how long it runs SEMICOLON-).)

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Load pg_hba.conf and pg_ident.conf on startup and SIGHUP into List of Lists, and use that for user validation. Bruce Momjian

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: DatabaseMetaData.getColumns() doesn't appear to get the default value for each column. Here is a context diff of CVS which should fix it. Jason Davies

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make OIDs optional, per discussions in pghackers. WITH OIDS is still the default, but OIDS are removed from many system catalogs that don't need them. Some interesting side effects: TOAST pointers are 20 bytes not 32 nowSEMICOLON pg_description has a three-column key instead of one. Bugs fixed in passing: BINARY cursors work againSEMICOLON pg_class.relhaspkey has some usefulnessSEMICOLON pg_dump dumps comments on indexes, rules, and triggers in a valid order. initdb forced.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: fix my old fault.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I noticed that pltcl didn't have any way to get to SPI_lastoid like plpgsql does.. I started using pltcl a lot because I like to decide when and how my queries get planned.. so I put one together really quick Sorry I don't have the original around to make a quick diff, but its a very small change... I think this should be in the next release, there's no reason not to have it. its a function with no expected arguments, so you can use it like: spi_exec "INSERT INTO mytable(columns...) VALUES(values..)" set oid [spi_lastoid] spi_exec "SELECT mytable_id from mytable WHERE oid=$oid" It just didn't make sense for me to use plpgsql and pltcl, or just screw them both and use SPI from C. bob@redivi.com

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove WIN32_NON_BLOCKING_CONNECTIONS tests, since we don't need 'em anymore.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress gcc warning in USE_LOCALE case.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: CREATE VIEW with optional column name list wasn't quite right for the case where there are resjunk columns in the query.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Mention that COPY cannot be used on a view (per recent suggestion). Other small improvements.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Since PQoidStatus is deprecated, we should probably stop using it in our own code ...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The portion about the PQgetssl() function in the libpq documentation appears to be duplicated (two identical <listitems> right after each other). Here is a quick patch to remove one instance of it. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: petere
Document.document: corrections from the DocNotes

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Per this discussion, here's a patch to implement both levenshtein() and metaphone() in a contrib. There seem to be a fair number of different approaches to both of these algorithms. I used the simplest case for levenshtein which has a cost of 1 for any character insertion, deletion, or substitution. For metaphone, I adapted the same code from CPAN that the PHP folks did. A couple of questions: 1. Does it make sense to fold the soundex contrib together with this one? 2. I was debating trying to add multibyte support to levenshtein (it would make no sense at all for metaphone), but a quick search through the contrib directory found no hits on the word MULTIBYTE. Should worry about adding multibyte support to levenshtein()? Joe Conway

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add a check for end of client connection before expecting a password response, to avoid noise in the server log.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a SPI_copytupledesc function that parallels SPI_copytuple --- ie, it copies the tupdesc into upper-executor memory. This is necessary for returning tuple descriptors without leaking all of lower exec memory.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Further thought shows that has_distinct_on_clause() needs to take much more care with resjunk tlist entries than it was doing. The original coding ignored resjunk entries entirely, but a resjunk entry that is in either the distinctClause or sortClause lists indicates that DISTINCT ON was used. It's important for ruleutils.c to get this right, else we may dump views using DISTINCT ON incorrectly.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Arrange for GRANT/REVOKE on a view to be dumped at the right time, namely after the view definition rather than before it. Bug introduced in 7.1 by changes to dump stuff in OID ordering.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Arrange for GRANT/REVOKE on a view to be dumped at the right time, namely after the view definition rather than before it. Bug introduced in 7.1 by changes to dump stuff in OID ordering.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Clean up some warnings and bugs and make things build easier.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix to prevent infinite loop when $PGDATA is not writable.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Use a fixed error message for ERANGE to avoid duplicate test result files. Add some resultmap entries for SCO OpenServer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add QueryIsRule gram.y reset.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove no-longer-needed fcntl call (I'm not sure it *ever* did anything useful, in fact).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add LOCK A,B,C functionality as LOCK ASEMICOLONLOCK BSEMICOLONLOCK CSEMICOLON as agreed. Neil Padgett

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > 1) When a row is retrieved, and then a SQL_FETCH_FIRST is issued, the check > in convert.c > does not consider the fact that the value in the field has been altered to > be a '1' if the > backend handed it a 't'. The net result being that the first row on any > subsequent queries > has all it's boolean set to 0. Aidan Mountford

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some poor decisions about sizing of trigger-related memory contexts.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add documentation changes for new pg_hba.conf behavior.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch merges the identical methods from the JDBC1 and JDBC2 connection implementations (org.postgresql.jdbc[1|2].Connection) into their superclass (org.postgresql.Connection). It also changes the close() methods of Connection and PG_Stream, so that PG_Stream no longer is responsible for sending the termination packet 'X' to the backend. I figured that protocol-level stuff like that belonged in Connection more than in PG_Stream. Anders Bengtsson
